result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence Izeiza Poe Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Restitution set at $11,399.75 payable to 
Wisconsin Child Support Trust Fund.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied towards restitution.  Remaining balance to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Pay all supervision fees

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No alcohol or controlled substances

-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Court urges Department of Probation to have defendant participate in the Children's First Program
-Defendant to make all future court appearances on case 08FA4178

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers

timeConds.notes: -As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on March 28, 2016 at 5:00 p.m.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Count 1 probation conditions apply except for House time.

miscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Clarence Izeiza Poe in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement made by:  Daytonna P.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  1 1/2 YEARS, with credit for 17 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $11,399.75 payable to Wisconsin Child Support Trust Fund.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied towards restitution.  Remaining balance to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Court urges Department of Probation to have defendant participate in the Children's First Program
-Defendant to make all future court appearances on case 08FA4178
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on March 28, 2016 at 5:00 p.m.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to COUNT 1.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid on COUNT 1
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-timeemployment 
-Court urges Department of Probation to have defendant participate in the Children's First Program
-Defendant to make all future court appearances on case 08FA4178
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  1 1/2 YEARS.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Court urges Department of Probation to have defendant participate in the Children's First Program
-Defendant to make all future court appearances on case 08FA4178
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Defendant Clarence Izeiza Poe in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 4 and 4 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNTS 1, 2 and 3.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNTS 1, 2 and 3.    Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNTS 1, 2 and 3 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Matter adjourned to 1:30 p.m. this date for sentencing.
